sentences.sContent: As to her own life, those good friends for years gradually estrange since she's always on the run. And there's still a void in her love life.
sentences.sContent_eng: As to her own life, those good friends for years gradually estrange since she's always on the run. And there's still a void in her love life.
sentences.sCn: 而自己的生活也因整日奔波，多年的朋友逐渐疏远，感情也一片空白。

sentences.sContent: Being short of honesty can both severely damage the image of the public security organs and estrange the relationship between the public security organs and the people.
sentences.sContent_eng: Being short of honesty can both severely damage the image of the public security organs and estrange the relationship between the public security organs and the people.
sentences.sCn: 缺乏诚信不仅严重损害公安机关的形象，还会造成公安机关与人民群众关系的疏远与隔膜。

sentences.sContent: “Technology does not need to estrange us from one another,” Cox said. “The physical reality comes alive with the human stories we have told there.”
sentences.sContent_eng: “Technology does not need to estrange us from one another,” Cox said. “The physical reality comes alive with the human stories we have told there.”
sentences.sCn: “技术不会使我们彼此疏离，”考克斯说道，“当我们来到那些有故事的地点时，现实也就活灵活现了。”

remMethod.val: e + strange(陌生的) → 使…陌生 → 使疏远

words.tran: 使疏远；使隔离；使离间（estrange的过去分词）
